Q.1. WHAT IS YOUR ARMY RANK OR GRADE*  1. PRIVATE OR PRIVATE FIRST CLASS 2. CORPORAL OR TECHNICIAN 5TH GRADE 3. SERGEANT OR TECHNICIAN 4TH GRADE 4. STAFF SERGEANT OR TECHNICIAN 3RD GRADE 5. TECHNICAL SERGEANT, MASTER SERGEANT, OR FIRST SERGEANT 6. NO ANSWER 0. NO CODE OR NO DATA
Q.2. HOW OLD WERE YOU ON YOUR LAST BIRTHDAY*  1. 20 YEARS OR YOUNGER 2. 21 TO 25 YEARS 3. 26 TO 30 YEARS 4. 31 TO 35 YEARS 5. 36 YEARS OR MORE 6. NO ANSWER 0. NO CODE OR NO DATA

Q.3. HOW FAR DID YOU GO IN SCHOOL*  1. LESS THAN 6TH GRADE 2. FINISHED 6TH GRADE 3. FINISHED 7TH GRADE 4. FINISHED 8TH GRADE 5. SOME HIGH SCHOOL BUT DID NOT FINISH 6. GRADUATED FROM HIGH SCHOOL 7. SOME COLLEGE BUT DID NOT FINISH 8. GRADUATED FROM COLLEGE 0. NO ANSWER

Q.4. IN WHAT STATE DID YOU SPEND MOST OF THE LAST FIVE YEARS OF YOUR CIVILIAN LIFE BEFORE YOU CAME INTO THE ARMY* E. SECTION:  1. NEW ENGLAND 2. MIDDLE ATLANTIC 3. EAST NORTH CENTRAL 4. WEST NORTH CENTRAL 5. SOUTH ATLANTIC 6. EAST SOUTH CENTRAL 7. WEST SOUTH CENTRAL 8. MOUNTAIN 9. PACIFIC 0. NO CODE OR NO DATA

Q.5. WHERE WERE YOU LIVING MOST OF THE LAST FIVE YEARS OF YOUR CIVILIAN LIFE BEFORE YOU CAME INTO THE ARMY*  1. ON A FARM OR IN THE COUNTRY 2. IN A SMALL TOWN (FEWER THAN 2,500 PEOPLE) 3. IN A TOWN (WITH BETWEEN 2,500 AND 25,000 PEOPLE) 4. IN A CITY (BETWEEN 25,000 AND 100,000 PEOPLE) 5. IN A LARGE CITY (MORE THAN 100,000 PEOPLE) 0. NO ANSWER
Q.6. ARE YOU:  1. SINGLE, AND NOT ENGAGED 2. SINGLE, BUT AM ENGAGED 3. MARRIED BEFORE ENTERING ARMY 4. MARRIED AFTER ENTERING ARMY 5. WIDOWED, DIVORCED, OR SEPARATED 0. NO ANSWER
Q.7. HOW LONG HAVE YOU BEEN IN THE ARMY*  1. LESS THAN 6 MONTHS 2. 6 MONTHS TO 1 YEAR 3. 1 YEAR TO 18 MONTHS 4. 18 MONTHS TO 2 YEARS 5. OVER 2 YEARS 0. NO ANSWER
Q.8. HOW LONG HAVE YOU BEEN IN THE BRITISH ISLES*  1. LESS THAN 3 MONTHS 2. 3 MONTHS TO 6 MONTHS 3. 6 MONTHS TO 1 YEAR 4. 1 YEAR TO 18 MONTHS 5. OVER 18 MONTHS 6. NO ANSWER 0. NO CODE OR NO DATA

Q.9. WHAT BRANCH OF THE ARMY ARE YOU IN NOW*  01. AIR CORPS 02. ARMORED FORCE 03. ARTILLERY 04. ENGINEERS 05. INFANTRY 06. MEDICAL DEPARTMENT 07. MILITARY POLICE 08. QUARTERMASTER CORPS 09. TRANSPORTATION CORPS 10. ORDNANCE DEPARTMENT, SIGNAL CORPS, CHEMICAL WARFARE SERVICE 11. OTHER 12. AIR COMBAT 00. NO ANSWER
Q.10. ON THE WHOLE, HOW DO YOU FEEL ABOUT THE ARMY*  1. I LIKE THE ARMY VERY MUCH 2. I LIKE IT FAIRLY WELL 3. I RATHER DISLIKE IT 4. I DISLIKE THE ARMY VERY MUCH 0. NO ANSWER

Q.11. DO YOU THINK YOU MIGHT WANT TO STAY IN THE ARMY AFTER THE WAR*  1. YES, I WOULD WANT TO VERY MUCH 2. YES, I MIGHT WANT TO BUT I,M NOT SURE 3. NO, I DON,T THINK I WOULD WANT TO 4. NO, I WOULD NOT WANT TO AT ALL 5. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER

Q.12. AFTER THE WAR, DO YOU THINK THE UNITED STATES COULD HAVE AN ARMY LARGE ENOUGH FOR THE COUNTRY,S NEEDS BY TAKING VOLUNTEERS ONLY*  1. YES, I THINK IT COULD 2. NO, I DO NOT THINK IT COULD 3. UNDECIDED 4. NO ANSWER 0. NO CODE OR NO DATA

Q.13. AFTER THE WAR, DO YOU THINK THE UNITED STATES SHOULD DRAFT ALL YOUNG MEN FOR A CERTAIN AMOUNT OF ARMY TRAINING DURING PEACETIME OR SHOULD WE GO BACK TO THE REGULAR ARMY SYSTEM OF TAKING VOLUNTEERS ONLY*  1. DRAFT ALL YOUNG MEN FOR A CERTAIN AMOUNT OF TRAINING 2. GO BACK TO TAKING VOLUNTEERS ONLY 3. UNDECIDED 4. NO ANSWER 0. NO CODE OR NO DATA

Q.14. WHICH OF THE FOLLOWING REASONS COMES CLOSEST TO SAYING WHY YOU THINK THE UNITED STATES SHOULD DRAFT ALL YOUNG MEN FOR A CERTAIN AMOUNT OF ARMY TRAINING DURING PEACETIME*  1. BECAUSE I THINK THE ARMY EXPERIENCE IS WORTHWHILE FOR YOUNG MEN 2. BECAUSE I THINK IT IS NECESSARY FOR THE SAFETY OF THE UNITED STATES 3. BECAUSE I THINK IT IS BOTH WORTHWHILE FOR YOUNG MEN AND NECESSARY FOR THE SAFETY OF THE UNITED STATES 4. FOR SOME OTHER REASON 5. I THINK THE UNITED STATES SHOULD GO BACK TO TAKING VOLUNTEERS ONLY 6. NO ANSWER 0. NO CODE OR NO DATA

Q.15. IF ALL YOUNG MEN IN THE UNITED STATES WERE TO BE GIVEN MILITARY TRAINING, AT ABOUT WHAT AGE DO YOU THINK THIS TRAINING SHOULD BEGIN*  1. BEFORE 18 YEARS OF AGE 2. AT 18 YEARS OF AGE 3. AT 19 YEARS OF AGE 4. AT 20 YEARS OF AGE 5. AT 21 YEARS OF AGE 6. AFTER 21 YEARS OF AGE 0. NO ANSWER

Q.16. IF ALL YOUNG MEN IN THE UNITED STATES WERE TO BE GIVEN MILITARY TRAINING FOR ABOUT HOW LONG A TIME DO YOU THINK THIS TRAINING SHOULD LAST*  1. ABOUT 6 MONTHS 2. ABOUT 1 YEAR 3. ABOUT 1 1/2 YEARS 4. ABOUT 2 YEARS 5. MORE THAN 2 YEARS 0. NO ANSWER

Q.17. ON THE WHOLE, DO YOU THINK THE ARMY IS GIVING YOU A CHANCE TO SHOW WHAT YOU CAN DO*  1. A VERY GOOD CHANCE 2. A FAIRLY GOOD CHANCE 3. NOT MUCH OF A CHANCE 4. NO CHANCE AT ALL 5. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER
Q.18. ON THE WHOLE, HOW IS THE MORALE OF THE MEN IN YOUR OUTFIT*  1. VERY HIGH 2. FAIRLY HIGH 3. JUST SO-SO 4. FAIRLY LOW 5. VERY LOW 0. NO ANSWER

Q.21. IN GENERAL, HOW WOULD YOU SAY YOU FEEL MOST OF THE TIME, IN GOOD SPIRITS OR IN LOW SPIRITS*  1. I AM USUALLY IN GOOD SPIRITS 2. I AM IN GOOD SPIRITS SOME OF THE TIME AND IN LOW SPIRITS SOME OF THE TIME 3. I AM USUALLY IN LOW SPIRITS 0. NO ANSWER
Q.22. DO YOU USALLY FEEL THAT WHAT YOU ARE DOING IN THE ARMY IS WORTHWHILE OR NOT*  1. I USUALLY FEEL IT IS NOT WORTHWHILE 2. I USUALLY FEEL IT IS WORTHWHILE 3. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER

Q.23. WOULD YOU SAY THAT MOST OF THE MEN IN YOUR OUTFIT USUALLY PUT ALL THEY HAVE INTO THEIR ARMY DUTIES AND TRAINING, OR DO THEY USUALLY WORK JUST HARD ENOUGH TO GET BY*  1. MOST OF THE MEN USUALLY PUT ALL THEY HAVE INTO IT 2. MOST OF THE MEN USUALLY WORK JUST HARD ENOUGH TO GET BY 3. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER

Q.24. HOW ABOUT YOU YOURSELF - WOULD YOU HONESTLY SAY THAT YOU USUALLY PUT ALL YOU HAVE INTO YOUR ARMY DUTIES AND TRAINING OR DO YOU USUALLY WORK JUST HARD ENOUGH TO GET BY*  1. I USUALLY PUT ALL I HAVE INTO IT 2. I USUALLY WORK JUST HARD ENOUGH TO GET BY 3. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER

Q.25. WHICH OF THE FOLLOWING STATEMENTS BEST TELLS THE WAY YOU FEEL ABOUT GETTING INTO AN ACTUAL BATTLE ZONE*  1. I WANT VERY MUCH TO GET INTO IT JUST AS SOON AS POSSIBLE 2. I,M READY TO GO ANYTIME 3. I,D LIKE TO GO BEFORE IT,S OVER BUT I DON,T THINK I,M READY YET 4. I HOPE I WON,T HAVE TO GO, BUT IF I DO, I THINK I,LL DO ALL RIGHT 5. I HOPE I WON,T HAVE TO GO BECAUSE I DON,T THINK I WOULD DO VERY WELL 0. NO ANSWER

Q.27. WOULD YOU CHANGE TO SOME OTHER ARMY JOB IF GIVEN A CHANCE*  1. YES 2. NO 3. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER

SOMEWHAT BETTER ONES COULD HAVE BEEN PICKED 4. MUCH BETTER ONES COULD HAVE BEEN PICKED 5. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER

THINGS ARE A LITTLE BETTER, BUT NOT MUCH 3. I DON,T SEE ANY DIFFERENCE 4. THINGS ARE A LITTLE WORSE 5. THINGS ARE A LOT WORSE 6. DON,T KNOW 7. NO ANSWER 0. NO CODE OR NO DATA

Q.34. WHICH DO YOU THINK WOULD BE THE BEST WAY FOR THE UNITED STATES TO KEEP OUT OF WAR IN THE FUTURE*  1. STAY OUT OF WORLD AFFAIRS 2. JOIN A STRONG ORGANIZATION OF NATIONS 3. ISOLATIONISTS PLAN: "TAKE NEITHER SIDE UNTIL FORCED INTO FOREIGN AFFAIRS," "MIND HER OWN BUSINESS," AND, "AVOID COMPLICATIONS" 4. IMPERIALIST PLAN: "LARGE ARMY TO TERRIORIZE ANY COUNTRY WHO STARTS TROUBLE," "DOMINATE ALL OTHER PEOPLES," "CONTROL BALANCE OF POWER," "PEACE-POWER TREATY" 5. INTERNATIONALIST PLAN: "CO-OPERATE WITH ENGLAND AND RUSSIA," "EDUCATION AND A SINGLE WORLD-WIDE GOVERNMENT," "PACT WITH BRITAIN" 6. SOME OTHER PLAN, NO PLAN, OR UNCLASSIFIED: "CAN,T - NO USE ANYWAY," "MAKE STRONG PEACE," "WIPE OUT PRESENT ENEMIES," "NO WAY TO STAY OUT OF WAR," "LET LEADERS DECIDE," "WIPE OUT ENEMIES" 7. UNDECIDED: "HARD TO SAY," "TIME WILL TELL, "DON,T KNOW - IT,S HARD" 8. PREPAREDNESS PLAN: "PREPAREDNESS," "LARGE ARMY, NAVY AND AIR FORCE," "GOOD ARMY AND RESERVES," "STAYING STRONG" 9. DISARMAMENT PLAN: "PREVENT ARMING OF NATIONS," "DISARM ALL OTHER COUNTRIES," "DISARM ENEMIES WITH STRONG FORCE," "PREVENT ENEMIES FROM RISING" 0. NO ANSWER

Q.35E. "AFTER THE WAR THERE SHOULD BE AN INTERNATIONALLY CONTROLLED ARMY TO POLICE THE WORLD"*  1. AGREE 2. DISAGREE 3. NO ANSWER 0. NO CODE OR NO DATA
